name: Royal Albatros Moderna Sharm el-Sheikh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel, can't fault it! Lovely room, well maintained & cleaned grounds, plenty of sunbeds & places to sunbathe & mostly the staff were friendly & helpful. Plenty to keep kids (& big kids) entertained & a relaxation pool for those looking for peace & quiet. The food was generally good & varied with a good choice of restaurants - shame only 1 a la carte but food quality in the buffet restaurants made up for it overall. Local drinks were a little dubious, but that seems par for the course in Sharm! Pluses were some nice additional touches including a pancake station & coffee shop - (we only found the ice cream in the coffee shop at the end of the week - don't miss out!!).
reviews.title: Something for everyone

reviews.text: For a week's relaxation in the sun, this hit the spot perfectly, would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: This was our first time in egypt, was totally amazed by this hotel, was the best hotel and holiday we have ever had by far! Staff were amazing .. the animation team were out of this world! all of them absolutely amazing!! Miss you lou lou!
reviews.title: 2nd Visit

reviews.text: It has everything and more, would highly recommend to anyone thinking of visiting egypt!
reviews.title: lives up to its name
Excellent. At last a great hotel in sharm.
reviews.text: Only been home 3 days and already booking our next stay!

Me my husband and 8 year old son stayed at the royal albertros from 1st of febuary for a week, first time we had been to egypt and it wont be the last!!!! the hotel was excellent very good choice of food and the staff were very friendly and always on hand with anythink you needed. While we were there we took a trip on a boat to go snorkling and if you wanted to you could pay to go diving which my husband did as he has always wanted to go diving, it was a brillient day trip me and my son stayed on the boat and had such a loverly time, we did this trip through shark diving centre and next time we go we will do more trips through shark diving centre as prices were very good and the people were really good.Cant wait untill next year to come back and stay for even longer, would recommend royal albertros to friends and relatives, also would like to say hello to crash from shark diving centre.
reviews.title: Best holiday

reviews.text: Stayed here for one week as a cheap get away to relax. First day spent at the spa, amazing time and got the price knocked down. Had a problem with the electricity in the room being cut of and found reception staff unhelpful. Called at 8.30 am and was still waiting two hours later. After many calls and trips to reception it was sorted. Found that at reception you get ignored unless you actually stand up for yourself and speak, of you don't, you would be standing there a long time. Also the reception staff seem to pass the buck with issues. Was surprised on checking out that we were also charged for playing billiards however on collecting the balls for the game,this wasn't voiced, 71 Egyptian pounds for an hour which is a little steap! However! Food was good, always found to be hot and plenty of choice, pools were fab but a little cold, the sea was actually a lot warmer! Deffonalt take the time to go snorkling, great experience! Columbus coffee was a lovely place to sit if you wanted timeout of the shade and made great coffees.
reviews.title: Fantastic week away to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4 of us stayed at Albatros Moderna for 8 great nights. Great situated by the private beach with easy access to private snorkelling paradise coral coast. Very big hotel with 6 all inclusive restaurants , lots of Bars opened from 10am till 12pm.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Irish Bar that has disco every night (btw irish only by name, no guinness,shame)
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Great Animation team keeping everybody entertained for whole day by the active pool area, and beach site. If u prefer to relax this hotel has big relaxation pool , wich is so quiet. Overal it has 4 pools - 2 on relaxation site ( one heated ) and 2 on active site (one for children with small slides) It has also few BIG SLIDES at the other end of hotel. Each pool has Bar , or two.
reviews.title: Great Week

reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at the Royal Albatros Moderna hotel, this was our 3rd visit to Egypt and 2nd to a Pick Albatros Hotel. We travelled as a family of 3, with a toddler.
reviews.title: Good facilities and a great place for chilling in the sun.

reviews.text: We were very disappointed with our check in and lack of information given. The person checking us in was not very welcoming, he barely spoke and had no eye contact. We were given our keys and told to give some tags to the bellboys for our bags to be delivered.
reviews.title: once again a excellent holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saw a sign at the side of reception for our room number, so followed that. That route took us down steps, up steps and down more steps. This was not very easy with a buggy and hand luggage. When we arrived at our room, it was on the 1st floor. We contacted reception and asked if we could move to a ground floor room - we had requested this when we booked, as it is easier with a toddler. We were told we had to go back to reception, when we explained that we had bags, buggy and child and would have to negotiate the steps again, so could we meet someone at another room - they were not interested. We went back to reception and I explained to the person who had initially checked us in. He didn't speak to me, just changed the room number on our envelope and recoded the key. It just so happened it was the room below the one we had just left, so I asked if there was another way to get there, so we didnt have to negotiate all the steps again. We were told of an alternate route, so off we went. By this point, we were not very impressed with the hotel and we wished we were back at the Sultan Gardens, where we had stayed last year.
reviews.title: OUTSTANDING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got to our room, which was a great size. It was a 2 bed family room/suite (this is what we had booked). The suite was tired looking. The settee and chairs needed a clean, the floor tiles were loose and cracked in places and the bathroom needed refurbishing. The room had everything we needed in it - bar an iron and ironing board. Location within the resort was good. The hot water was a bit hit and miss. For 2 nights we had cold showers and had to boil kettles to fill the bath for our child. This was reported, but not fixed before we left.
reviews.title: Relaxing week in the sun

reviews.text: We found the food in the restaurants very repetitive, though there were several restaurants, there was often a slight variation of the same dish in each restaurant. I think if you were there for longer than a week, you would get fed up of the food and would welcome a trip to Soho Square or a meal in the Thai White Elephant restaurant (payable) on site to break the monotony. We really liked the idea of being able to sit in certain areas and us all have different meals or something from one restaurant and something from another, as you sometimes don't want to eat the same things. Deserts were the same almost every meal and were bland and boring. We always found somewhere to sit and eat, though I think that may prove difficult at peak season.
reviews.title: Second visit

reviews.text: Friendly Staff, good food, especially the Tagineand the Italian, Every where very clean, selection of pools, comfy beds,
reviews.title: Family holiday to remember

reviews.text: Coffe bar great, ice cream 3-5 every day lovely Doughnuts and pancakes at 4 Several restaurants to choose from so not like canteen type rush for one place as sometimes happens at All inclusive
reviews.title: lovely return holdiday

reviews.text: Soap and shower gel and hairdryer in room and Towels round the pool to save on packing
reviews.title: a relaxing week

reviews.text: We looked out over the big pool and backed onto relaxsation pool 1836 (good spot quiet sun on balcolny all day) Pool man saved us our sun beds every day when he saw where we liked to be. Well worth a pound tip.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay and wonderful weather and I'd definitely go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did tip but used dollar bills as they can use them but pound coins ok and they just ask people to change them when they have enough for a note. Not expected but for so little the results were worth it
reviews.title: excellent all round!

aka: Royal Albatros Moderna Hotel Nabq Bay
description: Opened in 2004, the 5* resort has a dream location on the golden sandy beach on the new hotel zone of Nabq Bay, facing coral reefs in the crystal clear waters of the Red Sea, and the shipwrecks of the nearby Straits of Tiran. The main building and the attached two-storey building are surrounded by resplendent gardens extending down to the beach. This elegant all inclusive resort is only 12 km from Sharm El Sheikh Airport, and 20 km from the famous Naama-Bay.Whether you're celebrating an anniversary or honeymoon, planning a family vacation in Sharm El Sheikh or just wanting to get away from it all, Royal Albatros Moderna is the perfect place for all ages and interests.
